synthesis.method: continuous-flow reactor with a liquid-phase reduction method
synthesis.precursors: Iridium(III) acetylacetonate, palladium(II) acetylacetonate, platinum(II) acetylacetonate, rhodium(II) acetylacetonate, ruthenium(III) acetylacetonate

XRD.Vegard_law_observation: Lattice constant increases linearly with metal composition

physicochemical_characterization.HAADF-STEM: Homogeneous distribution of all five elements in each nanoparticle
physicochemical_characterization.EDX_maps: Elemental distribution for each element is approximately 20% of total composition, consistent with XRF results

electrochemical_performance.Tafel_slope_mV: Not explicitly mentioned, but overpotential at 10 mA/cm² is 6 mV, one-third of commercial Pt/C
electrochemical_performance.mass_activity_A_mg: 1.6 A/mg at -0.01 V, 8.0 times higher than commercial Pt/C
electrochemical_performance.stability: No significant degradation observed in polarization curves before and after durability test, indicating high stability in acidic conditions

theoretical_computations.reaction_mechanism: Intrinsic activity is likely influenced by both the size effect and high-entropy effect. The d-band center distribution is broader compared to monometals and binary alloys, contributing to high intrinsic activity.
